channel.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?
channel.description:
[size=12pt]Features[/size] # Built-in Wi-Fi: The new Xbox 360 is the only console with 802.11n Wi-Fi built-in for a faster and easier connection to Xbox LIVE. Stream HD movies and TV or download games from Xbox LIVE in 1080p and 5.1 surround sound from anywhere in the house. Compatible with b/g/n networks. # Xbox LIVE: Xbox LIVE brings a world of entertainment to you. Instantly stream movies and TV from Netflix–in crystal-clear HD, or download game add-ons like new levels, characters, maps and songs. Easily jump right into online multiplayer fun and play along with friends around the world. Plus, get your favorite music from Last.fm, connect with friends on Facebook® and post Tweets on Twitter. And Kinect will make your entertainment more extraordinary. Imagine controlling a movie with the wave of your hand or video chatting on your TV. Xbox LIVE is your connection to more games, entertainment and fun.* # 250GB Hard Drive: The internal, removable 250GB hard drive offers plenty of space to save games, HD TV and movies, music, pictures, game add-ons, demos and more. # Kinect Ready: Kinect brings games and entertainment to life in extraordinary new ways – no controller required. Easy to use and instantly fun, Kinect gets everyone off the couch moving, laughing and cheering. See a ball? Kick it. Want to join a friend in the fun? Simply jump in. Even control an HD movie with a wave of the hand. Featuring a dedicated, specialized port, the Xbox 360 250GB is built to connect seamlessly with the Kinect Sensor.* # Xbox 360 Wireless Controller (black): This awardwinning, high-performance wireless controller features a range of up to 30 feet and a battery life of 30 hours on two AA batteries. # Xbox 360 Headset (black): Chat with friends on Xbox LIVE, or team up and jump in with multiplayer game play. # More ports: Connect more accessories and storage solutions with added USB ports. Now with a total of 5, (3 back/2 front) you’ll find more places to plug and play. Plus, in addition to the standard Ethernet port and HDMI output, we’ve added an integrated optical audio out port for an easier connection to the booming sound of your A/V receiv
[img]http://www.gamestop.com/common/images/sscreen/1-7a76cf70-f974-4d13-9fcf-772565c00b20-s.jpg[/img]

item.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I still think its a pile of shit, their just adding a few updates to make it seem its the best thing.

item.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:21, topic:344677”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=441046.msg3240025#msg3240025 date=1276836170]
“Perfectly quiet” - Yes because the silent humming sound of an Xbox makes such a huge difference when I am playing a game.
[/quote]
orly? Every xbox I have every played is as loud as fuck and is much louder than a “silent hum”. It’s the cheap disk drives that they stick in them…
Obviously you do get used to the gay sound but it’s unacceptably loud for a console.[/quote]

I don’t seem to have that big of a problem with it :P. When I am playing a game like MW2 or another shooter I never hear it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:19, topic:344677”]Lol my wireless was beast and it is G, I was host every match and everyone had full bars.[/quote]Ooh very nice I have a Netgear Rangemax Dualband router which runs N and G, and I can only use G for most devices in my house. Considering the 360 can use N, Ill probably be getting host every match too

item.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:16, topic:344677”]Wireless is shit, you will never get wireless to be wired. Just wire the dam thing its less of a hassle and you don’t need to pay for an upgraded wireless card.[/quote]I don’t think I really could wire it, considering my router is on the other side of my house from my room on the second floor, where as my room is on the ground floor. Imo, wiring would be more of a hassle unless I bridge to my computer’s wireless connection with is shit. The XBox’s 5GHz might actually avoid interference in my house. Besides, my wireless connection is pretty damn good overall. When I play CoD on Wii I get host most of the matches, giving everyone 3-4 bars.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

CoonHunter:

The only thing that even brings my eye over to this new Xbox is the fact of Built-In WiFi, 250GB HD, but that is all. The rest of the upgrades I could care less about. So to me, I would rather just get the new HD, and a wireless adapter. I already have a USB HUB hooked up to myn, so I don’t even need a 250GB hdd.

I have the same 120GB that came with my Elite, and I haven’t even used 10% of it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox 360 ftw?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Why should I pay another 300 dollars for a bigger hard drive and a few upgrades?

“Perfectly quiet” - Yes because the silent humming sound of an Xbox makes such a huge difference when I am playing a game.

Kinect is the only thing I really find cool. However when I did some research there is a lot of ways it could also be glitchy.

I perfectly understand this if you don’t already have an Xbox, otherwise I find it to be a complete waste of money.

Read full topic

How much is it going to cost?
[/quote]
Same price as an elite ($299?).

I would get one, but I’m quite content with my 120gb hard drive and wireless adapter. Other than that there is no difference between the elite and this. [/quote]I paid $650 when I bought my red limited edition Resident Evil one Bought it like a week after it came out that’s why.

Note: the Resident Evil game that comes with it, valued at $120 at the time, I gave it straight back not even a minute after buying, and he only gave me 30$ back… I HADN’T EVEN TOUCHED THE CASE! :@
